page.title: 20Farming near Fraserburgh
page.content: The land around Fraserburgh is mostly used for farming. There are{pig {units, dairy farms,}and a large number of farms producing{arable crops}and {beef. { Grain}is regularly{exported}from the {harbour at Fraserburgh}and the Fraserburgh Grain Company has a{grain {storage and drying}facility at Crimmond Aerodrome. Cattle , sheep and other livestock marketing is done at either{Maud}or {Aberdeen Marts,}but animals for slaughter must be transported out of Fraserburgh. There are a number of farms with {horse-riding facilities}and{riding {schools,}including those which provide {riding for the disabled.}This pastime is particularly popular with the girls of the locality and many own their own pony. (Fraserburgh Academy:A.H.Smith)
